mini_game
Class SpriteType

java.lang.Object
  mini_game.SpriteType

public class SpriteType
extends java.lang.Object

A SpriteType describes a particular type of Sprite. In most games, artwork is shared between similar game objects. So, if a game has 20 Orcs, they all share the same artwork. We don't want to load images for each Orc, that's a waste of resources. Instead, we load the art once, and share it. This is common practice in all types of applications.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Richard McKenna

this SpriteType's unique ID

getStateImage

public java.awt.Image getStateImage(java.lang.String stateName)
Accessor method for accessing and returning the Image that correponds to a given state.

Parameters:
stateName - the state for which one wishes to access the image.
Returns:
the image registered for the stateName state.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Accesses and returns the height of all the images used by this SpriteType. Note that all images for a given SpriteType should be identically sized.

Returns:
the height in pixels of this SpriteType

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Accesses and returns the width of all the images used by this SpriteType. Note that all images for a given SpriteType should be identically sized.

Returns:
the width in pixels of this SpriteType

addState

public void addState(java.lang.String stateName,
                     java.awt.Image img)
Adds a state, along with its corresponding image, to this SpriteType object.

Parameters:
stateName - the state to use in registering the image.
img - the Image to use for rendering when a given SpriteType is set with stateName as its state
